FuncDef:
The virtual-cluster-access mac command configures a MAC address for a virtual cluster access interface.
The undo virtual-cluster-access mac command restores the default MAC address of a virtual cluster access interface.
By default, the MAC address of a virtual cluster access interface is DCD2-FC92-B0BE.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the MAC address of a virtual cluster access interface.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The virtual-cluster-access mac command is used to change the MAC address of a virtual cluster access interface. By default, all virtual cluster access interfaces have the same MAC address. If all virtual cluster access interfaces with the same MAC address enter the same Layer 2 network, an error occurs. In this scenario, you need to change the MAC address of a virtual cluster access interface.
Configuration Impact
If the virtual-cluster-access mac command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
